revised_title: Election of Fellows at the Annual Meeting, June 7, 1888
tldr: At the Annual Meeting of the Royal Society on June 7, 1888, several candidates were elected as new fellows. The meeting was presided over by President G.G. Stokes, and Sir William Bowman and Dr. Gladstone were appointed scrutators to assist the secretaries in examining the lists. The newly elected fellows included Thomas Andrews, James Thomson Bottomley, and others.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Scientific community
